answers.answer: Every pregnancy is different I was like that before my third month I couldnt stop eating I went to the doctor and he said drink more water or things like juice but ut could be different with you it wont hurt to ask your doc :)

I felt that way with my second pregnancy and ended up having gestational diabetes. Any history of diabetes in you or you family?  My OB usually checks for it around 24 weeks, but I think each practice is different. I would talk to your doc and maybe they would check early
I did the same thing in the beginning. . I'm 30 weeks now no gestational diabetes or anything. I'm having a very healthy boy

Vasfam, I was going to thru the same thing.  It's actually due to morning sickness.  U think you'll feel better if u eat cuz Ur hungry, but then if u don't u feel a knot like u need to throw up, at least that's how it is for me.  I actually gained 13 lbs in my first trimester and I'm only 15 wks.  Thankfully the m/s has subsided some, but I still occasionally feel hungry all the time even when I just ate!!  it's the pregnancy doing this to u and it is normal..

I was STARVING my entire first trimester. I never actually threw up, but if I didn't drink a big glass of water & eat something as soon as I woke up, I would be nausious all day! Then I had to keep small, healthy snacks with me all the time to stay ahead of the nausia & hollow, starving feeling! I'm now 38 weeks with a very healthy boy! Can't wait to meet him!
With my first it was like that all day sickness threw the whole pregnancy and exactly the same eat to not feel sick and feel sick if I  was full. He is a healthy 3 year old now and I survived.
Oh try just nibbling on food carrots crackers anything, that's what helped me.

Thank you guys!! My sister had me worried that something could be wrong, but I never felt that way, I figured it was just from a horrible third pregnancy Lol I'll run it by my Dr when I next him in 2 weeks but until then I'll try to keep this belly full. Although diabetes runs in my family (we always fail the first glucose test) no one yet has had gestational diabetes, thank goodness. My grandfather is the only one who has it as of right now and it is controlled and getting better with his lifestyle!

That is exactly how I feel!! It drives me nuts! I'm glad to see that it at least dwindles down...prepregnancy I had lost 15 lbs..and finally 3 months later I am back to what my weight was before..it has gone up or down though, I'm pretty active and just never stop eating so i dont have to feel sick! lol I feel so much better knowing that im not alone :)

question: Okay ladies I have a question, my sister says this is not normal but its now my fourth pregnancy, third child be be born :) I'm in my third month and no matter what I do whether it be be drinking or eating I always feel hungry...but then if I eat to much my stomach is full and still wants more food...I feel like its a lose lose situation...if I don't eat or drink enough I always feel nauseous and if I eat to much then I feel sick to my stomach :( I have tried to find a balance but nothing is working..y sister says that I need to speak to my Dr about it since she has never hears of eating to not feel sick anymore nor did I have this issue with my other pregnancies...I need some advice on what to do..
title: mommy sickness help!
